text: Evaluate this requirement: "The system shall refresh the display every 60 seconds" against R1: Need and requirement statements must conform to one of the agreed patterns, thus resulting in a well-structured complete statement.

Evaluate this requirement: "The system shall refresh the display every 60 seconds" against R6: When stating quantities, all numbers should have appropriate and consistent units of measure explicitly stated using a common measurement system in terms of the thing the number refers.

Evaluate this requirement: "The system shall refresh the display every 60 seconds" against R16: Avoid the use of 'not'.

Evaluate this requirement: "The system shall refresh the display every 60 seconds" against R26: Avoid using unachievable absolutes such as 100% reliability, 100% availability, all, every, always, never, etc.

Evaluate this requirement: "The system shall refresh the display every 60 seconds" against R27: State conditions’ applicability explicitly instead of leaving applicability to be inferred from the context.
Evaluate this requirement: "The system shall refresh the display every 60 seconds" against R32: Use 'each' instead of 'all', 'any', or 'both' when universal quantification is intended.

Evaluate this requirement: "The system shall refresh the display every 60 seconds" against R33: Define each quantity with a range of values appropriate to the entity to which the quantity applies and against which the entity will be verified or validated.
